      • getResourceLabel

        protected java.lang.String getResourceLabel()
        Overrides:
        getResourceLabel in class Resource
        Returns:
        a value that is a useful label for identifying this resource instance, which can be used for log messages. Defaults to getResourceId, as that's normally a good candidate for a label.

      • getResourceManager

        protected ResourceManager getResourceManager()
        Specified by:
        getResourceManager in class Resource
        Returns:
        a ResourceManager instance that will be used for the persistence methods in this class

      • getResourceId

        protected java.lang.String getResourceId()
        Specified by:
        getResourceId in class Resource
        Returns:
        the unique identifier for this resource, which will be used for the persistence methods in this class

      • save

        public java.lang.String save()
        save is tricky for forests, because many of the properties are read-only, and thus ForestManager does not yet support updates. Another tricky part is that "localhost" won't work as a hostname - it has to be the real hostname. So if it's not set, we have to fetch it from the cluster.
        Overrides:
        save in class Resource
        Returns:
        a receipt string containing the path and HTTP status code
